p: The reducing ability of the plant extracts of E. fluctuans was evaluated by the method as described by Oyaizu [ 18]. The extract or standard solutions (1 mL) were added to 2.5 mL each of potassium buffer (0.2 M) and potassium ferricyanide (1% w/ v) and mixed gently. The reaction mixture was incubated at 50°C for 20 minutes followed by the addition of 2.5 mL of trichloroacetic acid (10% w/ v) solution. Centrifugation (3000 rpm, 10 minutes) of the mixture was performed to get the clear supernatant solution. Supernatant solution (2.5 mL) was added to 0.5 mL of ferric chloride (0.1% w/ v) solution and distilled water (2.5 mL), and the absorbance of the solution was read by a spectrophotometer at 700 nm. For comparison, catechin was taken as a reference standard.
